dt.t: Snakes nested in the {wi}nether{/wi} reaches of the cave.

dt: {bc}situated or believed to be situated beneath the earth's surface

dt.t: captured her and carried her off to the {wi}nether{/wi} world to be his wife

et: Middle English, from Old English {it}nithera{/it}, from {it}nither{/it} down; akin to Old High German {it}nidar{/it} down, Sanskrit {it}ni{/it}
shortdef: situated or believed to be situated beneath the earth's surface

dt.t: His shorts fell down and exposed his {it}nether parts/regions{/it}.
